column8: Text (SA - Special Ability; WS - When Starting; OC - On Closing)
Until this Ticket is closed, no other AI Ticket can be worked on (of any category).
column10: One of the main concerns: whether to use Markets for referencing them like this.

column8: You can only place counters on this Ticket when there 2 or fewer non-Completed Features in the Product.
Only the CTO can place counters on this Ticket.
WS: Place 1 counter on this Ticket for every 5 TECH Tickets in the Word discard pile.
column10: Probably should be in reverse? If 3 or fewer, then API integration is fast?

column8: To close this Ticket, spend your action and roll a die. On 6, close it.
WS: Roll a die. Place that many counters on this Ticket. Anyone can spend their action to remove one counter. At 0, close it.
WS: For each standalone group of Completed single-Market Features, place 1 counter on this Ticket. If 6 counters or more, close this Ticket.
column10: Need to reformulate the "standalone group" term, or use that mechanic more often so that it's in the glossary.

column8: WS: Place 1 counter on this Ticket for each Completed Feature that has matching Markets with the Feature under this Ticket.

Place 1 counter on this Ticket for every Open DESIGN or MARKETING Ticket (this one included; up to 10 counters).

Spend your action to remove a counter from thie Ticket. At 0, close it.
You may spend your action and discard 3 cards from your hand to close this Ticket at once.
This Ticket acts as if it belongs to each category.
SA: Roll a die. On 5-6, place as many counters on this Ticket as there are on the cheapest adjacent Ticket (on 4 sides). If 5 counters or more, close this Ticket.
OC: If there is another Ticket under this one and if that's a TECH Ticket, roll a die. On 6, close that other Ticket as well.

column5: AI Isn't A Pit, AI Is A Mirror
column8: When placing a counter on this Ticket, place instead as many counters as there are cards in the hand of the player who has the least cards.
column10: Originally, the name was "AI Isn't A Mind, It's A Mirror"

column8:
OC: The player who closed this Ticket either:
- draws a card if this is the last Ticket before the Feature is Completed
- discards a card otherwise
You cannot conventionally place a counter on this Ticket. Instead, spend your action and roll a die. On 6, close this Ticket.
WS: Place 5 counters on this Ticket. For each currently open TECH Ticket in the Product, remove 1 counter.
Discard a card every time you place counters on this Ticket.

Pull one counter from every adjacent (on 4 sides) Ticket, if possible.

Spend your action to remove a counter from this Ticket. At 0, close it.
You cannot conventionally place a counter on this Ticket. Instead, spend your action and roll a die. On 5-6, place a counter on it.
